item.title: Jupyter
item.description: Running the notebooks # To install the necessary software, I recommend doing so in a Python virtual environment. We need Python3. Doing something like: $ python3 -m venv sci-comp $ . sci-comp/bin/activate # Or other script if you use a different shell $ pip install numpy scipy pandas ipython jupyter $ cd path/to/repo/material $ jupyter notebook Will pop up a browser window. item.title: MPI
item.description: Options for running MPI programs # For the larger parallel runs in the course, and benchmarking, we will use the Hamilton cluster. You may wish to do development on your own machine. I provide some brief guidance on what you need in terms of appropriate compilers and MPI implementations. Hamilton access and quickstart # If you don’t already have an account on Hamilton, please register for one by following their instructions.
